thread.title_full: Elijah Wood Shooting in an underground mine for The Last Witch Hunter was torturous

title: Elijah Wood Shooting in an underground mine for The Last Witch Hunter was torturous
text:
Elijah Wood: Shooting in an underground mine for The Last Witch Hunter was 'torturous' 
Irish Examiner Sunday 25th October, 2015 
Elijah Wood may have played a hobbit who lives in a hole, but it was while shooting The Last Witch Hunter that he really went underground – spending weeks filming inside a limestone mine. 
Part of the film was shot on location in an underground system of mines, just outside of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. Elijah stars as Dolan 37th, a young priest who advises Vin Diesel’s immortal Witch Hunter character, Kaulder, as they take on the witches who live among us. 
';Oh god, the mine,'; he recalled. ';The mine was kind of torturous.';
